content.description: Climb bouldery moves up to the large hanging block, the "swamp cooler".  Clip a bolt and more strenuous moves lead to another bolt.  Easier but heads up climbing leads up and left from there to a double bolt anchor.  Bring a selection of gear for the upper part.  (Shares the same anchors as the Oracle)
content.protection: quickdraws, a selection of small to medium cams.
content.location: This route is on the Cathedral about 10 feet right of the start of the Oracle.

content.description: Diagonal up and right. The first bolt comes and goes. Not sure why. A .5 tcu fixes that problem, or just boulder up to the next bolt. Steep climbing heads up through overlaps and cracks to a two-bolt anchor. 60m rope gets you up and down.
content.protection: Bolts, one or two .5" cams optional
content.location: Uphill from Feast of Friend, shares the start of Brass Buster

climbs.name: Son of Scab (aka Fake Son of Slab)

content.description: At least two people have confused this route for Son of Slab.  This is a bolted line up nice rock marked by several flat landing areas, just off the trail when you arrive at the Cathedral.  The start can be done straight up the bolt line at around 11b, or you can skip the crux by climbing in from the right.  After the initial steepness and a nice flat ledge, there's one more little burst of difficulty followed by mellow, low angled knob climbing to the chains.  I enjoyed this route and am happy to add FA data!
content.location: First visible route as you arrive at the Cathedral, facing the trail.  To the left around the corner is Celestial Ascension.  Son of Slab is found 50 feet uphill to the right.

content.description: Climb the roof protected by a bolt and some pretty burly moves.  Bring some small to medium cams for above the roof.  The rock is dirty and dusty above the roof.  Climb up and left to easier ground.  I belayed and rappelled from the large tree which grows from the canyon floor and is close to the wall directly above this route.
content.location: This route is located on the Cathedral about halfway in between Devil Tree and Swamp Cooler.  It is easily identifiable by a 3 foot roof protected with a bolt and about a foot from the bolt, a lost arrow piton.

content.description: Tricky crux start protected by wireds or small TCUs.
content.protection: Standard rack with small stuff for the start.
content.location: Obvious slanting crack rising from the creekbed on the N-facing aspect of the Cathedral.

climbs.name: Nuptial Vow
climbs.fa: L. Ellison, P. Scannell, B. Smoot - Sans Bolts, 1983

content.description: This climbs the right bolt line on the far west end of the North face of the Cathedral.  Did you get all of that?  It climbs a horizontally cracked face with small but juggy overhangs.
content.protection: 2 bolts are up top for the anchors and 4 draws for the climb.  However, these bolts are, I believe 1/4 inch buttonheads with home made hangers.  Be careful, or use some gear.  Bolt 2 made no sense, and I didn't clip it.

content.description: Fun route that initially wanders a bit right of the bolt line. Cool horizontal features typical of Ferguson's.
content.location: Bolt line rising from the creek immediately right of the crack Mission Impossible on the left side of the north face of the Cathedral.

content.description: This is the West most route on the North face of the Cathedral.  Again horizontally cracked steep but juggy climbing.  I felt it was as hard as Nuptial Vow, next door.
content.protection: 2 bolts are up top for the anchors.  3 draws for the climb. Again, 1/4" buttonheads with homemade hangers.

content.description: This climbs the right-facing large crack, just right of the 2 bolted lines on the west end of the wall.  Steep hand and fist crack.  With a good fist jam to pop the crux.  Nice climb.
content.protection: 2 bolts for the anchors up top, and large gear for the route.

content.description:
Strenuous moves in a dihedral lead to a knifeblade in a horizontal.  Another big move leads to good cracks above.  Where the crack kind of runs out, continue straight up the face past gear placements in horizontals.  A final mantle onto a slab and a good horizontal crack to set up a gear belay.

To descend, and easy scramble right (about 5.4) from the natural anchor will lead you to a set of chains on top of Celestial Ascension.  Rappel from there.
content.protection: A set of cams from small to #2 camalot size.  Be sure to save two or three for the belay.  The horizontal crack for the belay is varied in size.
content.location: To the right of Swamp Cooler is Painted Bird, which has a bolt and pin at a 3 foot roof.  To the right of that is "Tainted Word" which has a fixed knifeblade above a small roof.  Just to the right of that is a clean dihedral with a fixed knifeblade in a horizontal above the end of the dihedral.  This is "Karmic Trace".  The next route to the right is "Devil Tree".

content.description: Left slanting crack left of Celestial Ascension. There is a devilish tree in front of the route. Deceptively difficult.
content.protection: Descent is off the chains for Celestial Ascension or by walking down a gully to the east.Top is natural anchors.

content.description: This is a short route with some fun moves.  It is the first route on the cathedral's west face.  It's also starts right off the main hiking trail.  The start of the climb is probably the crux, climbing into the dihedral.  Bring long slings to extend the chains at the top over the boulder if you are setting up a top rope.
content.protection: a set of stoppers and a small cam or two.  chains at the top for top roping

content.description:
Aftershock

starts out casual, climbing a steep, blocky ramp. Encounter a ledge and find some protection. Prepare yourself here for the next series of very committing moves. -Turning back will be difficult- Proceed with caution up and right through flakes and crimps, moving and stemming carefully through the crux. Stay tight and watch those feet; clip a piton and jam to more secure ground. Follow the crack around the face and locate the anchors.

Aftershock

originally had a bolt to protect the crux. It appears and disappears leaving holes and bolt sleeves. With help from MW of the ASCA, we patched this hole in Aug 08. The crux was found to be adequately protected without the bolt.
content.protection: Set of Stoppers, Cams from .3 to #3 bd, and slings. One piton plus chains.
content.location:
Aftershock

is on the East facing wall of the

The Cathedral

. This route starts just right of

Skinny Len Crimps

on blocky, bulging terrain.
